result.execSummary:
The defendant Ayana Holifield-Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 3 but  consecutive to 22CM1368 with credit for 3 days served. Huber privileges to be determined by HOC.
Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 7/12/22.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample during term of probation.
DV assessments imposed on both counts.
Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA and DV surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
Court set restitution at zero.
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
No contact with firearms.
Court will allow for expungement upon the successful completion of probation.

Complete batterer's intervention program.
Complete Parenting Classes.
Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
Third party contact for the purpose of time with children.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 2 but consecutive to 22CM1368, with credit for 3 days served. Huber privileges to be determined by HOC.
Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 7/12/22.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ayana Holifield-Brown

defendant.name: Holifield-Brown, Ayana
defendant.address: 191 East Fairmount Avenue #4, Whitefish Bay, WI 53217

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ayana Holifield-Brown in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea and sentencing hearing held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding her right to have an in-person hearing.  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 1 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to count 3 but consecutive to 22CM1368, with credit for 3 days served. Huber privileges to be determined by HOC.

AS TO COUNT 3: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, concurrent to count 2 but consecutive to 22CM1368, with credit for 3 days served. Huber privileges to be determined by HOC.

Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Third party contact for the purpose of time with children. 
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Complete 25 hours of community service.
- DV assessment imposed, as to both counts.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
- Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA and DV surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.

- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 7/12/22.
*Court will allow for expungement upon the successful completion of probation.

Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, filed.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights, filed.

Defendant Ayana Holifield-Brown in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Ayana Holifield-Brown in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel needs discovery and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with CLB.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ayana Holifield-Brown in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Ayana Holifield-Brown in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
